alert.note: Alert for Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 11 at 8:54PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Illinois, including the following county, Stephenson. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of light to moderate rain are expected to redevelop tonight and last into Monday morning, leading to 48 hour rainfall totals between 2 and 4 inches across Stephenson County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
